title: Great Comet of 1882
summary:
The Great Comet of 1882 formally designated C/1882 R1, 1882 II, and 1882b, was a comet which became very bright in September 1882. It was a member of the Kreutz Sungrazers, a family of comets which pass within 1 R☉ of the Sun's photosphere at perihelion.[1][2]
The comet was bright enough to be visible next to the Sun in the daytime sky at its perihelion.[3]
